task_summary: Detect and grasp the white plate, move to the red plate area, gently place the white plate onto the red plate, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A 6-DoF arm with a parallel gripper operates on a tabletop. The goal is to pick a white plate and place it on a nearby red plate/tray. The contact sheet shows approach, grasp, lift/transfer, and a likely placement near the red surface. The behavior emphasizes reliable perception of both targets, precise alignment before grasping, gentle contact while placing, and a short retreat to clear the workspace.
preconditions: Workspace free of obstacles around plates
stepwise_plan: Open gripper and detect the white plate.
Move above and align to the white plate; compute a top grasp.
Detect the red plate and move above it.
Lower until contact on the red plate and place.
Open the gripper to release and retreat.
success_criteria: White plate placed stably on red plate
No collisions with table or environment
Gripper empty at end and robot retracted
failure_and_recovery: Perception miss → retry detection up to 3 times
No contact sensed while lowering → abort place and re-scan
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after successful release on the red plate and retreat, or after retries are exhausted.

frame_3.now_evidence: First clear grasp engagement with the white plate visible near the gripper; alignment appears correct.
frame_3.predicts_next: Expect lift/transfer towards the red plate.

task_instruction: Pick up a white plate, and then place it on the red plate.

node_specs.description: Open gripper to maximum width before grasping and to release after placing.
Perceive white plate location; wrapped with retry.
Compute top grasp for the plate.
Perceive red plate location; wrapped with retry.
Transit above red plate for placement.
Controlled descent until contact with red plate surface.
Place white plate on red plate.
Back off to a safe pose after release.

failure_modes: White plate not detected due to glare
Grasp slips because of plate curvature
Red plate pose inaccurate causing misplacement
recovery_strategy: Re-align with tighter tolerance and re-attempt pick
Abort place, re-scan red plate, and re-approach
Retreat and pause if unexpected contact occurs
assumptions: Frames indicate grasp and transfer; final placement atop the red plate is partially occluded/blurred. We assume successful placement consistent with the task.
Top grasp is feasible for this plate; suction not required.

expected_success_criteria: White plate stably resting on red plate after OpenGripper
